alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 12:16PM MDT until May 05 at 11:50AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. .Recent warm temperatures and snowmelt will result in minor flooding on Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera each morning through Friday. The river will fluctuate between flood and action stage, with the highest flows during the morning. Farm and pasture land may be inundated with damage to irrigation channels and gates possible. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera. * WHEN...From this morning to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Farm and pasture land is being inundated, and irrigation channels and gates may be severely damaged if high flows persist. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 6.76 feet. - The Rio Ojo Caliente reached 6.96 ft early this morning and has since decreased to 6.76 ft. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of around 7.1 feet Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday mornings. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 06/29/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Rio Ojo Caliente La Madera 7.0 6.76 Tue 7 am MDT 7.1 7.1 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 915 PM MDT.
